#sidebar SyntaxSidebar
= `ifVar` =
[http://code.google.com/p/querytemplates/w/list Wiki] > [Syntax Syntax] > [ifSyntax if] > [ifVarMethod ifVar]
=== Parameters ===
 * *$var* _string_
  Dot-separated object path, eg Object.property.inneProperty
 * *$separate* _bool_ = `false`
  Determines if selected elements should be wrapped together or one-by-one


=== Description ===
Wraps selected tag with PHP "if" statement checking if $var evaluates  to true. $var must be an object available inside template's scope.


$var is passed in JS object convention (dot separated).


Optional $separate parameter determines if selected elements should be  wrapped together or one-by-one. This is usefull when stack contains non-sibling  nodes.


Method doesn't change selected elements stack. Returned is source element.


Notice-safe.


Example
{{{
 $template['node1']->ifVar('foo.bar.1');

}}}
Source
{{{
 <node1/>

}}}
Result
{{{
 <?php
 if ($foo->bar->{1}) {
 ?><node/><?php
 }
 ?>

}}}
----
